009package imagingbook.common.hough.lines;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.Shape;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.ShapeProvider;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.HessianLine;
021
022/**
023 * This class represents a straight line used by the Hough transform
024 * (see {@link imagingbook.common.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
025 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
026 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
027 * It adds an arbitrary reference point and a counter for pixel votes.
028 */
029public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine>, ShapeProvider {
030        
031        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
032        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
033        
034        
035        // static factory methods -------------------------------
036        
037        public static HoughLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
038                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
039        }
040        
041        // constructors -----------------------------------------
042        
043        public HoughLine(double a, double b, double c, double xR, double yR, int count) {
044                super(a, b, c);
045                this.xRef = xR;
046                this.yRef = yR;
047                this.count = count;
048        }
049
050        /**
051         * Constructor.
052         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
053         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
054         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
055         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
056         * @param count pixel votes for this line
057         */
058        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
059                super(angle, radius);
060                this.xRef = xRef;
061                this.yRef = yRef;
062                this.count = count;
063        }
064        
065        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line) {
066                this(line, 0.0, 0.0, 0);
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor. 
071         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
072         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
073         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
074         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
075         * effects only a shift of the line).
076         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
077         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
078         * line and the new line.
079         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
080         * @param xR reference point x-coordinate
081         * @param yR reference point y-coordinate
082         * @param count pixel votes for this line
083         */
084        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xR, double yR, int count) {
085                super(line.getA(),
086                          line.getB(),
087                          line.getC() + line.getA()*(xR-line.getXref()) + line.getB()*(yR-line.getYref())); // = a', b', c'
088                this.xRef = xR;
089                this.yRef = yR;
090                this.count = count;
091        }
092        
093        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
094        
095        /**
096         * @return The accumulator count associated with this line.
097         */
098        public int getCount() {
099                return count;
100        }
101        
102        @Override
103        public double getXref() {
104                return xRef;
105        }
106        
107        @Override
108        public double getYref() {
109                return yRef;
110        }
111        
112        // other methods ------------------------------------------
113        
114        /**
115         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
116         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
117         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
118         */
119        @Override
120        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
121                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
122        }
123        
124        @Override
125        public String toString() {
126                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
127                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
128        }
129        
130        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
131        
132        public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
133                double xRef = this.getXref();
134                double yRef = this.getYref();
135                double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height));
136                double angle = this.getAngle();
137                double radius = this.getRadius();
138                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
139                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
140                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
141                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
142                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
143                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
144                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
145                double x1 = x0 + dy * length;
146                double y1 = y0 - dx * length;
147                double x2 = x0 - dy * length;
148                double y2 = y0 + dx * length;
149                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
150                path.moveTo(x1, y1);
151                path.lineTo(x2, y2);
152                return path;
153        }
154
155        @Override
156        public Shape getShape(double length) {
157                double xRef = this.getXref();
158                double yRef = this.getYref();
159//              double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height)); //Math.sqrt(sqr(xRef) + sqr(yRef));
160                double angle = this.getAngle();
161                double radius = this.getRadius();
162                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
163                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
164                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
165                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
166                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
167                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
168                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
169//              float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
170//              float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
171//              float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
172//              float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
173//              float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
174//              float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
175                //Roi roi = new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
176                
177                double x1 = x0 + dy * length;
178                double y1 = y0 - dx * length;
179                double x2 = x0 - dy * length;
180                double y2 = y0 + dx * length;
181                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
182                path.moveTo(x1, y1);
183                path.lineTo(x2, y2);
184                return path;
185        }
186        
187
188//      /**
189//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
190//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
191//       * is equivalent to the distance of the reference point (typically the
192//       * image center) to the coordinate origin.
193//       * @return the new line
194//       * @deprecated
195//       */
196//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi() {
197//              double length = Math.sqrt(xRef * xRef + yRef * yRef);
198//              return this.makeLineRoi(length);
199//      }
200        
201//      /**
202//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
203//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
204//       * is measured from its center point (the point closest to the reference
205//       * point) in both directions.
206//       * 
207//       * @param length the length of the line
208//       * @return the new line
209//       */
210//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi(double length) {
211//              // unit vector perpendicular to the line
212//              double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
213//              double dy = Math.sin(angle);
214//              // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
215//              double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
216//              double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
217//              // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
218//              float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
219//              float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
220//              float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
221//              float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
222//              float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
223//              float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
224//              return new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
225//      }
226
227}
